title: gary10x
content:
One interesting find: 

I started speaking english in my daily life these daysâ€” with friends and with AI â€” more than half of my output is now in english

I noticed that I can think directly in English as long as I know the key words of the topic

My reading also got better, because I stopped translating and started understanding things instantly

So the takeaway is: 

If you want to improve your English, start with output. It forces your â€œEnglish modeâ€ to turn on, and then all the input you consume begins to reinforce that mode

goated projects in 2025: 
Hyperliquid, MetaDAO, Pump.fun, Pendle , FomoApp

stable:
july 2025, the Genius Act was signed, marking the first regulatory framework for payment stablecoins that requires 100% cash or short-term treasury backing -> over **$100B** in stablecoin net inflows this year
Yield bearing stablecoin (YBS): total supply of YBS has actually 2x this year, reaching **$12.5B**,the growth is largely driven by yield provider such as BlackRock BUIDL, Ethena, and sUSDs

perpdex:
perp DEX open interest has grown 3â€“4x on average, rising from $3B to $11B and peaking at **$23B**
Perp trading volume also exploded and up 4x since the start of the year, climbing from an astounding amount of $80B to over **$300B weekly volume** (Partly because of points farming too), representing one of the most explosive growing sector in crypto
HL perp volume has reached 10% of Binanceâ€™s and the trend continue

dat:
Over the year, around **76** new DATs were formed. In total, DATs now hold $137B worth of crypto assets in their treasuries. Of that, 82%+ is in BTC, about 13% in ETH, and the remainder spread across different altcoins.
Bitmine (BMNR) by Tom Lee has been one of the defining highlights of this DAT wave, becoming the largest buyer of ETH among all DAT participants.
But despite the early hype, most DAT stocks pumped and dumped within the first 10 days. After 10/10, inflows into DATs collapsed by 90% compared to July levels, and most DATs have fallen below 1 mNAV, signaling that premiums have evaporated and the DAT hype cycle has largely ended.
